generatedTitle: what makes a substance dissolve in water

extractFactDictList.question: How many factors determine whether a substance will dissolve in water?
extractFactDictList.sentence: One of the main factors that determine whether a substance will dissolve in water is its polarity.

extractFactDictList.question: Polar molecules have a partial positive charge on which end?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Polar molecules have an uneven distribution of electrons, which gives them a partial positive charge on one end and a partial negative charge on the other.

extractFactDictList.question: What end of a water molecule has a positive charge?
extractFactDictList.sentence: Water molecules also have a partial positive charge on one end and a partial negative charge on the other, which allows them to form hydrogen bonds with other polar molecules.
